solution_line_template: They earned {num_shoes} x ${shoe_price} = $<<{num_shoes}*{shoe_price}={shoes_earning}>>{shoes_earning} for the shoes they sold.
They earned {num_shirts} x ${shirt_price} = <<{num_shirts}*{shirt_price}={shirts_earning}>>{shirts_earning} for the shirts they sold.
So, they earned ${shoes_earning} + ${shirts_earning} = $<<{shoes_earning}+{shirts_earning}={total_earning}>>{total_earning} in total for the clothing they sold.
Therefore, Sab and Dane earned ${total_earning} / {num_people} = $<<{total_earning}/{num_people}={earning_each}>>{earning_each} each.
